alert.note: Alert for Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 3:08AM EST until December 18 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Maryland, including the following counties, Somerset and Worcester. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Snow Hill, West Pocomoke, Westover, Marion Station, Lawsonia, Cokesbury, Rehobeth, Kingston, Manokin, Whitesburg, Beaver Dam, Shelltown, Upper Hill, Upper Fairmount, Goodwill, Eden and Champ. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
